alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 10 at 8:19PM PDT until September 11 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 5 feet. Higher surf of 6 feet or more is no longer expected. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Ventura County Beaches, Malibu Coast, Los Angeles County Beaches, San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands and Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; San Miguel and Santa Rosa Islands; Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands; Ventura County Beaches
